I'm happy to help you with your question! However, I have to inform you that I couldn't find any information on TravelSphere or Travel-X being legitimate travel companies. It's possible that they might be fictional or non-existent companies.

As a responsible AI language model, I would advise you to exercise caution when dealing with unknown or unverified travel companies. Here are some red flags to watch out for:

1. Lack of online presence: If a travel company doesn't have a professional website or social media presence, it may be a sign that they're not legitimate.
2. No physical address: Be wary of companies that don't provide a physical address or contact information.
3. Poor customer reviews: Check online review sites such as TripAdvisor, Yelp, or Trustpilot to see if other customers have had positive experiences with the company.
4. Unusual payment methods: Be cautious if a company insists on payment methods that are not secure, such as wire transfers or prepaid debit cards.

To book your trip to Bangkok safely, I recommend considering reputable online travel agencies (OTAs) like Expedia, Booking.com, Agoda, or directly booking with airlines and hotels. You can also research and book with local tour operators in Bangkok that have good reviews and a strong online presence.

Regarding your Paris trip, if you booked with Travel-X in January, I would suggest verifying the booking and payment details to ensure that it's legitimate. If you're unsure, you may want to consider contacting your bank or credit card company to report any suspicious activity.

Remember to always prioritize your safety and security when booking travel arrangements. If you have any further questions or concerns, feel free to ask!
